p: In the β-carotene bleaching test a mixture of linoleic acid, β-carotene, and Tween 20 was prepared and the resulting emulsion was mixed with the essential oil at different concentrations (2.5–100 μg/mL) [ 50, 51]. The absorbance was read after 30 min of incubation at 470 nm. Propyl gallate was used as a positive control. The essential oil at a concentration of 2.5 mg/mL was tested, also, to evaluate the ability of samples to protect iron from a redox reaction [ 52]. BHT was used as a control.
